Sentencas: The traditional voltage-to-current flash sintering experiments are characterized by an abrupt rise in the electrical conductivity and power dissipated in the sample.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: This results in variation in microstructural features such as grain size, grain size distribution, and relative density across the length of the sample and sometimes current localization.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: Unlike the normal voltage-to-current flash experiments the current-controlled experiments are characterized by a linear rise in the current (at a constant rate) and this results in uniform microstructure in the entire volume of the sample.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: In the present work, composites of 3YSZ and Ni, with different Ni contents (5, 10 and 20 wt%) were subjected to current-controlled flash sintering experiments at a constant current density rate of 600 mA/mm2.min with a target current density of 100 mA/mm2.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: The total span of the experiments varied from 36 to 46 s.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: The extent of densification decreased with the increase in nickel content in the composites.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: In addition, samples with higher nickel content started to densify at higher current densities.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction revealed that oxidation of the nickel particles occurred during flash sintering.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: Interrupted flash sintering experiments showed that oxidation of Ni particles occurred before sintering in the composites.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: The microstructure of flash sintered composite was characterized by fine grains (smaller than conventionally sintered samples) with narrow grain size distribution.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: The composites with 20 wt% Ni exhibited a microstructure with percolating network of NiO phase.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: No significant difference in the sintering behavior and microstructure was observed when the current rate was changed to 300 mA/mm2.min.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: By annealing the samples in reducing atmosphere NiO can be transformed back to Ni, thereby generating additional porosity.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications

Sentencas: The processed samples can have possible applications in designing the anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: A first study on the current-controlled flash sintering experiments on 3YSZ-Ni composites for SOFC anode applications
